item.description:
Sunday April 29th, we are going to hike the Nayantaquit Trail in Lyme, CT


Difficulty: Moderate (Gently rising terrain with the likeliness to encounter occasional obstacles)

Elevation Gain: 400 feet Primary Walking Surface: Earth

Suitable for ages: all; Children all; Teenagers all; Adults: all; Martians and other ETIs:  all.

Total walking route length: 3.5 miles

Trail Map: (We are parking in the top parking place on this map) http://www.ct.gov/dep...

Update to Trail directions: http://www.ctwoodland...

Info: http://www.trails.com...

More Info: http://www.ctmuseumqu... Note: The driving directions are a little tricky We are going to meet in the North parking lot off Keeny Rd. Highly recommended that you adjust your directions to approach the trail from Beaver Brook Rd. (The North) as Keeny Rd. is a dirt road and was supposedly redone but is still a litle rough. Approaching from the top (off Beaver Brook Rd.) we are only on Keeny Rd. for a very short time and it is reported to be in good shape. Head down Keeny Rd. a short ways and the parking lot is on the right side.

But Wait!  Yet More Info!:  During the winter months, please plan your travels to arrive at 10:00am.  Even though we frequently wait until 10:10am to start the hike, this 10 minute buffer is at the discretion of the hike organizers - and at the ultimate discretion of Mother Nature and the amount of cold winds that She blasts at us just standing around.


Google Maps: http://maps.google.co...
item.how_to_find_us: Fred and I will be there!!
item.name: Nayantaquit Trail
